To proof.
MS annotation by M: 'Answ 9/12/91. FvM'. Letter not found. Hobart,

Very many thanks for your assistance.
Letter not found.?
Having no local herbarium one is more dependant on your kindness than would otherwise be the case.

The specimen of Veronica serpillifolia was found by Wm Fitzgerald on the west coast & was far enough from other aliens to lead him to infer it indigenous.
sic.
I have since found it on Mt. Wellington
Tas. more or less associated with what I have always taken to be V. periquinia[.]
editorial addition. All [.] in the following text have this meaning. I enclose a specimen. Am I correct.

The peculiar fruiting of the specimen of Polypodium Australe entirely misled me. The sori in the young fronds commence in two lines parallet to midrib & margin & the margin is somewhat contracted towards them.

I always look out for C[unn]acae & other water plants for you but have little opportunity & as yet have been very unsuccessful[.] I enclose a water weed but I fear it is but an alga. It is from a stream near Langley. Also a dwarf rush somewhat near Juncus capillaceus but I cannot conclude it is that species. While I am about it I enclose two specimens of grass I take to be extreme varieties of Poa australis am I right. The foliage in both is similar inc[…]
squashed at end of line.
margins, setaceous.

I also enclose what I take to be Pomaderris racemosa I am not aware it has been found in the southern part of the Island before Also a specimen of Melaleca squamea with unusually large petals, leaves with indistinct veins that are often five in number.
Trusting I am not trespassing too much on your valuable time, believe me

div.p: P.S. I notice Plusinia is just coming above the ground. Shall I place some plants in spirit for your reference when you come over?
